MARITAL STATUS

Professions Actor , Producer , Executive Producer more

Birth name Thomas Jeffrey Hanks

Nationality American

Birth July 9, 1956 (Oakland, California – United States)

BIOGRAPHY

Tom Hanks, whose real name is Thomas J. Hanks, grew up in a blended family. He discovered theater as a teenager: he quickly understood that he had just found his vocation and that he would make it his profession. In 1978, Tom Hanks ended his studies and left for New York to become an actor. It was with Noces Sanglantes (1980) that he took his first steps in cinema. Then followed multiple appearances in television series until 1984, where he made his mark on the big screen alongside Daryl Hannah in Splash , a Disney comedy. Despite this first success, the following films were not successful. It was not until 1988 and Big that his career exploded: a specialist in comedies, he acquired the favor of the public and the profession. Indeed, the actor then obtained his first Oscar nomination.

It was by playing a homosexual lawyer suffering from AIDS in Philadelphia that he received his first Oscar for Best Actor in 1993, and thereby gained recognition from the public and his peers. He will receive a new statuette for his performance in Forrest Gump the following year; an extremely rare privilege that only the great American actor Spencer Tracy possessed before him. Under the direction of Ron Howard , Tom Hanks successfully made the transition to the Oscars since the film Apollo 13 , a story of the conquest of space, was a hit. He then became “Americans’ favorite actor”, a title that polls attributed to him several times. He is recognized for the diversity of his acting, as comfortable in comedies as in drama. The actor even goes off the beaten track by lending his voice to the cowboy Woody in Toy Story , the first all-3D film made by a young, still little-known studio called Pixar …

In 1996, he moved to the other side of the camera and made his first film about a rock group, That Thing You Do , a well-mastered essay. The meeting between Spielberg and Hanks gives him the opportunity to once again assert his talent in Saving Private Ryan . Two years later, he found the filmmaker again for Catch Me If You Can and shared the poster with another star, Leonardo DiCaprio . In 2000, he played in Zemeckis ‘ Alone in the World , based on an idea of ​​his, a castaway isolated for several years on a desert island following a plane crash, which earned him the Golden Globe for best actor. Always present on television,Brothers in Arms around the Second World War, a success both public and critical. A wise producer, he is behind the adventure Greek Wedding , one of the most profitable independent films in the history of cinema. A success nevertheless spoiled by the financial disputes which followed the success of the film, the actor claiming part of the profits.

He changes register by playing a hitman in The Paths of Perdition by Sam Mendes . The year 2003 turned out to be very prolific for Tom Hanks. In addition to a third collaboration with his friend Spielberg for the filming of The Terminal , he is starring in the Coen brothers’ comedy , Ladykillers . He also reunited with Zemeckis for Le Pôle Express , a film made entirely in motion capture allowing the actor to play five different characters. Passionate about History, he is also the producer of numerous educational documentaries, and often lends his voice, as in From the Earth to the Moon on the conquest of space or for A History of Us on the history of the United States. He is also the official voice of several national museums.

In 2006, he played Professor Langdon in the highly anticipated Da Vinci Code , adaptation of Dan Brown ‘s controversial novel , which opened the 2006 Cannes Film Festival. The actor received a colossal fee for this. In 2007, he timidly entered committed cinema by playing in the biopic of a famous American politician, Charlie Wilson’s War by Mike Nichols , where he rubbed shoulders with Julia Roberts and Philip Seymour Hoffman . Winner of two Oscars, he was appointed vice-president of the prestigious Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS), after having been its treasurer for many years.

In 2009, Tom Hanks returned to the fantastical world of Ron Howard in the thriller Angels and Demons , a new adaptation of the eponymous best-seller by Dan Brown . The following year, the actor gave pride of place to animated films: producer of Spike Jonze ‘s film , Max and the Maximons , he then found Woody, the famous cowboy from Toy Story , to whom he once again lent his voice in the third and final part of the saga , as well as in the short film derived from the sagaToy Story: Hawaiian Vacation (2011). 2010 is also the year of the broadcast of the series The Pacific , in which Tom Hanks and Steven Spielberg participate as executive producers. He returned for the second time behind the camera for the film It’s Never Too Late , in which he also played the leading role, alongside actress Julia Roberts . This time he chooses to feature a fifty-year-old who is determined to change his life.

In 2011, he can be found in the drama Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close and in two new short films from the Toy Story trilogy, Mini Buzz and Partysaurus Rex , in which he once again doubles as Woody. The following year, he achieved the incredible performance of playing five roles in the science fiction film Cloud Atlas , before switching to more realistic registers, producing Parkland on the assassination of President Kennedy and playing Captain Phillips (2013), victim of Somali piracy. After reuniting with Spielberg once again for Bridge of Spies , the actor found Robert Langdon’s costume for Inferno . However, he showed something new by shooting for the first time for Clint Eastwood and with white hair in the highly anticipated Sully , the true story of the airline pilot who saved his passengers by landing on the Hudson.

Teaming up once again with Steven Spielberg for the spy film Pentagon Papers in 2018, Tom Hanks then found notable roles in Greengrass’ Netflix western The Mission , the submarine film USS Greyhound – The Battle of the Atlantic , as well as the biopics The Amazing Mr. Rogers and Elvis . He’s heading into 2023 by playing a grumpy neighbor in The Worst Neighbor in the World and joining the cast of Wes Anderson ‘s Asteroid City .
